title: Christine McGuinness reveals husband Paddy has lost his wedding ring AGAIN
text:
Christine McGuinness has revealed that husband Paddy has lost his wedding ring for the second time.

The mother-of-three, 31, took to Instagram on Monday to post a loved-up selfie with her spouse and told fans that he'd lost the ring during a family getaway two months ago and is yet to replace it.

But Christine insisted that she's already forgiven Paddy, 46, for misplacing the ring, as she joked that he's wearing a T-shirt with her bikini-clad body.

Where's it gone? Christine McGuinness has revealed that husband Paddy has lost his wedding ring for the second time

In the post, Christine noted Paddy's hilarious blunder, and insisted that she's not too upset with the loss as he already has the ring tattooed on his finger.

The selfie showed Paddy - who she married in 2011 - wearing the t-shirt emblazoned with a bikini sketch that was the spitting image of his stunning spouse.

She wrote: 'My wonderful husband @mcguinness.paddy lost his wedding ring.. again.. on our family holiday about 2 months ago!. He still hasn’t replaced it but today he is forgiven because he’s wearing a T shirt with my picture on!

'#over12years #StillStrong #HeHasItTattoodAnyway!'

Hilarious: As Christine posted a loved-up snap with her spouse she revealed that he misplaced the ring during a family holiday two months ago and is yet to replace it

Sparkling: The star also said that the Take Me Out host (pictured with his wedding ring in December 2018) already has the band tattooed on his finger

The outing came just weeks after Christine spoke candidly about her struggles to conceive her first child after overcoming anorexia, during a candid interview on Giovanna Fletcher's Happy Mum Happy Baby.

The RHOC star - who shares Leo and Penelope, six, and three-year-old Felicity, with her husband Paddy - also admitted she feared miscarrying her twins when she was three months pregnant after experiencing heavy bleeding.

Bravely sharing her past battle, the TV personality explained she was anorexic during her teenage years, which had a massive impact on her family planning journey.

Close: Paddy and Christine have been married since 2011, and are parents to children Leo and Penelope, six, and Felicity, three (pictured together in January)

The reality star detailed: 'I had anorexia for over 10 years as a child, all through my teenage years, [and was getting better] when I met my husband aged 19, 20. It was that strive and I just really wanted to be a mum that made me get over that.

'When I went to see a doctor the reason I wasn’t ovulating or having my periods was down to having an eating disorder. That made me get better but it took four years for everything to regulate.

'You’re tracking your chart and your temperature. My husband works away a lot so we had to make the most of our time together.'
description: The mother-of-three, 31, took to Instagram on Monday to share a sweet selfie with her husband, and told fans he'd lost the ring during a family holiday two months ago and is yet to replace it.
